speaker: Daniel
text: We must finish the slides by tonight. The meeting’s first thing tomorrow morning.
ipa: wi mʌst ˈfɪnɪʃ ðə slaɪdz baɪ təˈnaɪt | ðə ˈmitɪŋz ˈfɜrst θɪŋ təˈmɑroʊ ˈmɔrnɪŋ
stress: WE must FINISH the SLIDES by toNIGHT | the MEETING’S FIRST THING toMORROW MORNING
linking:
"must finish" → /mʌst ˈfɪnɪʃ/ (t links to f)
"slides by" → /slaɪdz baɪ/ (z links to b)
"meeting's first" → /ˈmitɪŋz ˈfɜrst/ (z links to f)

speaker: Emma
text: Yeah, you're right. We should also double-check the data. Last time, a typo could have cost us the project.
ipa: jæ | jʊr raɪt | wi ʃʊd ˈɔlsoʊ ˈdʌbəl ʧɛk ðə ˈdeɪtə | læst taɪm | ə ˈtaɪpoʊ kʊd həv kɔst ʌs ðə ˈprɑʤɛkt
stress: YEAH | you're RIGHT | we SHOULD ALSO DOUBLE-CHECK the DATA | LAST TIME | a TYPO could have COST us the PROJECT
linking:
"should also" → /ʃʊd ˈɔlsoʊ/ (d links to a)
"double-check" → /ˈdʌbəl ʧɛk/ (l links to ch)
"could have" → /kʊd həv/ (d links to h)

speaker: Daniel
text: Good point. Maybe we ought to run a practice session too, just to be sure everything flows well.
ipa: ɡʊd pɔɪnt | ˈmeɪbi wi ɔt tu rʌn ə ˈpræktɪs ˈsɛʃən tu | ʤʌst tu bi ʃʊr ˈɛvrɪθɪŋ floʊz wɛl
stress: GOOD POINT | MAYBE we OUGHT TO RUN a PRACTICE SESSION TOO | JUST TO BE SURE EVERYTHING FLOWS WELL
linking:
"ought to" → /ɔt tu/ (t links to t)
"just to" → /ʤʌst tu/ (t links to t)
"flows well" → /floʊz wɛl/ (z links to w)

speaker: Emma
text: Agreed. Also, the boss said we have to include the new market analysis. I might stay a bit late to work on it if needed.
ipa: əˈɡrid | ˈɔlsoʊ | ðə bɔs sɛd wi hæv tu ɪnˈklud ðə nu ˈmɑrkɪt əˈnæləsɪs | aɪ maɪt steɪ ə bɪt leɪt tu wɜrk ɑn ɪt ɪf ˈnidɪd
stress: AGREED | ALSO | the BOSS SAID we HAVE TO INCLUDE the NEW MARKET ANALYSIS | I MIGHT STAY a BIT LATE to WORK on IT if NEEDED
linking:
"have to" → /hæv tu/ (v links to t)
"stay a" → /steɪ ə/ (y links to a)
"work on" → /wɜrk ɑn/ (k links to o)

speaker: Daniel
text: Thanks, Emma. I could help you if you want. Two heads are better than one.
ipa: θæŋks ˈɛmə | aɪ kʊd hɛlp ju ɪf ju wɑnt | tu hɛdz ɑr ˈbɛtər ðæn wʌn
stress: THANKS, EMMA | I COULD HELP YOU if YOU WANT | TWO HEADS are BETTER than ONE
linking:
"could help" → /kʊd hɛlp/ (d links to h)
"help you" → /hɛlp ju/ (p links to y)
"are better" → /ɑr ˈbɛtər/ (r links to b)

speaker: Emma
text: That would be great! Plus, we shouldn't forget to update the client list. I almost left it out last time.
ipa: ðæt wʊd bi ɡreɪt | plʌs | wi ˈʃʊdənt fərˈɡɛt tu ˈʌpˌdeɪt ðə ˈklaɪənt lɪst | aɪ ˈɔlmoʊst lɛft ɪt aʊt læst taɪm
stress: THAT WOULD BE GREAT | PLUS | we SHOULDN'T FORGET to UPDATE the CLIENT LIST | I ALMOST LEFT IT OUT LAST TIME
linking:
"would be" → /wʊd bi/ (d links to b)
"shouldn't forget" → /ˈʃʊdənt fərˈɡɛt/ (t links to f)
"left it" → /lɛft ɪt/ (t links to i)

speaker: Daniel
text: Haha, no worries. Oh, by the way — we don't have to bring printed copies, right? I heard it's all digital now.
ipa: hɑ hɑ | noʊ ˈwɜriz | oʊ | baɪ ðə weɪ — wi doʊnt hæv tu brɪŋ ˈprɪntɪd ˈkɑpiz | raɪt | aɪ hɜrd ɪts ɔl ˈdɪʤɪtəl naʊ
stress: HAHA | NO WORRIES | OH | BY THE WAY — we DON'T HAVE TO BRING PRINTED COPIES | RIGHT | I HEARD IT'S ALL DIGITAL NOW
linking:
"don't have to" → /doʊnt hæv tu/ (t links to h)
"have to bring" → /hæv tu brɪŋ/ (v links to b)
"heard it's" → /hɜrd ɪts/ (d links to i)

speaker: Emma
text: Yeah, that's true. But we might want to bring a few, just in case the projector fails or something.
ipa: jæ | ðæts tru | bʌt wi maɪt wɑnt tu brɪŋ ə fju | ʤʌst ɪn keɪs ðə prəˈʤɛktər feɪlz ɔr ˈsʌmθɪŋ
stress: YEAH | THAT'S TRUE | BUT we MIGHT WANT TO BRING a FEW | JUST IN CASE the PROJECTOR FAILS or SOMETHING
linking:
"might want to" → /maɪt wɑnt tu/ (t links to w)
"just in" → /ʤʌst ɪn/ (t links to i)
"projector fails" → /prəˈʤɛktər feɪlz/ (r links to f)

speaker: Daniel
text: Good thinking. Better safe than sorry.
ipa: ɡʊd ˈθɪŋkɪŋ | ˈbɛtər seɪf ðæn ˈsɑri
stress: GOOD THINKING | BETTER SAFE than SORRY
linking:
"better safe" → /ˈbɛtər seɪf/ (r links to s)
"safe than" → /seɪf ðæn/ (f links to th)
